Grant Proposal: Chattanooga Hockey

Introduction:
Chattanooga Hockey is a well-established and growing inline hockey league, operating as a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. Since 2002, we have been providing opportunities for over 150 adult and youth players to develop their hockey skills, engage in healthy competition, and foster a love of the sport. Our focus is on promoting sportsmanship, character development, and community involvement, while ensuring a safe and fun environment for all players.

Purpose:
The purpose of this grant proposal is to secure funding for the continued operations and growth of Chattanooga Hockey. Our goal is to provide necessary resources, including equipment, training, and facilities, to support our players and promote the sport of inline hockey in the Chattanooga area.

Program Description:
Chattanooga Hockey offers adult (age 16+) and youth divisions for players aged 5-9 (U9) and 10-15 (U15). Our program is run by a board of volunteers and emphasizes safety, fair play, and fun, and is designed to accommodate players of all skill levels, from beginner to advanced.

Financial Needs:
As a non-profit organization, Chattanooga Hockey relies on community support to continue our program. Our primary needs include funding for equipment, training, facilities, and administrative expenses. With the support of this grant, we will be able to further our mission to encourage participation, develop character, advocate sportsmanship, and promote community engagement in inline hockey.

Location:
Chattanooga, TN is a prime location for inline hockey, being only a few hours from major cities such as Atlanta, Nashville, and Asheville. Inline hockey is becoming increasingly popular across the country, and our league is well-positioned to meet the demand for this fast-growing sport.

Conclusion:
Chattanooga Hockey is a thriving inline hockey league with a long history of providing a safe, fun, and supportive environment for players of all ages. With your support, we will continue to serve the Chattanooga community and promote the sport of inline hockey. Thank you for considering this grant proposal.
